params.taskDescription: At a charity event with 58 people in attendance, 3 raffle winners are chosen. All receive the same prize, so order doesn’t matter. You are attending with 4 of your friends. What is the probability that at least one of you or your friends wins a raffle prize? Hint: Find the probability that none of you wins, and use the formula for complements.
params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>1</mn>
  <mo>−<!-- − --></mo>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <msub>
        <mi></mi>
        <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
          <mn>53</mn>
        </mrow>
      </msub>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <msub>
          <mi>C</mi>
          <mn>3</mn>
        </msub>
      </mrow>
    </mrow>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <msub>
        <mi></mi>
        <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
          <mn>58</mn>
        </mrow>
      </msub>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <msub>
          <mi>C</mi>
          <mn>3</mn>
        </msub>
      </mrow>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
  <mo>≈<!-- ≈ --></mo>
  <mn>10.7</mn>
  <mi mathvariant="normal">%<!-- % --></mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">1 - \frac{{_{53}{C_3}}}{{_{58}{C_3}}} \approx 10.7\%</annotation></semantics></math>

params.taskDescription:
If you draw a hand of 5 cards from a standard deck, what is the probability that 2 cards are  <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi mathvariant="normal">♠<!-- ♠ --></mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\spadesuit</annotation></semantics></math> and 3 cards are <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">♡</annotation></semantics></math>?
params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <msub>
        <mi></mi>
        <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
          <mn>13</mn>
        </mrow>
      </msub>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <msub>
          <mi>C</mi>
          <mn>2</mn>
        </msub>
      </mrow>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
        <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
        <msub>
          <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
          <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mn>13</mn>
          </mrow>
        </msub>
      </mrow>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <msub>
          <mi>C</mi>
          <mn>3</mn>
        </msub>
      </mrow>
    </mrow>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <msub>
        <mi></mi>
        <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
          <mn>52</mn>
        </mrow>
      </msub>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <msub>
          <mi>C</mi>
          <mn>5</mn>
        </msub>
      </mrow>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
  <mo>≈<!-- ≈ --></mo>
  <mn>0.86</mn>
  <mi mathvariant="normal">%<!-- % --></mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{{_{13}{C_2}{\, \times \, _{13}}{C_3}}}{{_{52}{C_5}}} \approx 0.86\%</annotation></semantics></math>
